title: `/debug` mode no longer works in Console
body:
### User Story

As a 3rd party developer, I want to turn `/debug` mode on in `Console` so that I can build and test my DApp in Status.

### Description

*Type*: Bug

*Summary*:  You need to enable `debug` mode in Status in order to for `status-dev-cli` to work between your machine and device. It no longer does.

#### Expected behavior
[comment]: # Sending the `/debug` command to `Console` after enabling `Developer mode` should result in a message being passed back to me about how `status-dev-cli scan` should now return the IP of my connected device.

#### Actual behavior
[comment]: # The `/debug` message is seen, but there is no response.

### Reproduction

- Open Status
- Go to profile and turn on Developer Mode in Advanced Options.
- Navigate to `Console`
- Send `/debug` message

### Additional Information
* Status version: Latest nightlies, but also on 0.9.15 in Play Store, where I can't even access `Advanced Options`.
* Operating System: Android

#### Logs

[comment]: # (if on Android please replicate bug whilst running adb logcat)

in the latest status version on the Android store [ 0.9.19 (6034)] and latest released nightlies [0.9.20 (6058]) /debug no longer works, again it seems.
